en: Please don't sit in that chair.

te: అవి రెండూ తెలుగు నవలలు.ఇవి రెండూ ఇంగ్లీషు నవలలు.
en: Those two are Telugu novels, these two are English novels.
Their names are Mañci Manasu (Good Heart) and Jīvitam (The life).
Who are the authors of those books?
These books are written by the same author, Aruna!
Papa don't turn on the fan.
Don't shut the window shutters so harsh, dear!
Is Gopalarao the writer of those books?
He is also a good poet.
His younger brother is also a good poet.
My brother is also a poet.
See this photograph, I am also in that.
Are they younger sisters of your friend?
These two are Girija's younger sisters.
This is Rama, Girija's younger sister (sibling).
This is Suguna, a friend of Girija's sister.
All these four are my friends.
When is your Delhi tour, madam?
The cold is not much in the first week of December.
They are in the last week of March, madam.
good; nice; well; fine (a bound form which always occurs with the existential verb forms such as బాగుంది ‘It is fine.’, బాగున్నాను ‘I am fine.’, etc.)
the heart which is the seat or repository of emotions
1. to turn on, to switch on; 2. to shut (like a door or a shutter)
1. to turn off, to switch off ; 2. to shut (like a door or a shutter)
father’s elder brother; mother’s elder sister’s husband
There is no problem; It is all right.
